intro: Pedicularis pedemontana, commonly known as the Alpine lousewort, is a flowering plant native to the mountainous regions of Europe. It belongs to the Orobanchaceae family, which includes many parasitic and hemiparasitic species. The plant is characterized by its striking red or orange flowers that bloom in late spring to early summer. It typically grows in alpine meadows and rocky habitats, thriving at high altitudes. Its unique appearance and ecological role make it a notable species in its native environment.
